alert.note: Alert for Monona (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 23 at 1:54PM CST until December 24 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central Iowa and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
